definitions: To fasten or tighten with a lace or laces.
To add a small amount of a substance (especially alcohol or a drug) to a drink or food.
To adorn or trim with lace.
examples: She will lace up her boots before the hike.
He decided to lace his coffee with a shot of whiskey.
The chef will lace the dessert with a hint of almond.
The dress was laced with delicate embroidery.
